comments.body:
I'm not sure I like the`${id_field:?}` workaround for https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/SC2154, this is just making the error go away rather than address what's happening

`id_field` is set in `runTests()` in `test/cmd/legacy_script.sh`, as are a bunch of other field/path constants... why are these not setup as exported constants?

Yes, it was discussed at https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/74279#issuecomment-466884613.
Seems changing all of them to uppercase is not a good idea too.
ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇ ok, I apologize, clearly I can't seem to make up my mind, let's just move ahead as is

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@  ### Create a new namespace
  # Pre-condition: the test-jobs namespace does not exist
  kube::test::get_object_assert 'namespaces' "{{range.items}}{{ if eq ${id_field:?} \\\"test-jobs\\\" }}found{{end}}{{end}}:" ':'
  # Command
  kubectl create namespace test-jobs

comments.body:
Another https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/SC2154 issue for `kube_flags`... in this case it appears dynamically constructed rather than a constant.  I still feel like this isn't actually addressing the failure.  The `:?` is redundant in the face of `set -o nounset`

Maybe alter this function to take kube_flags as a parameter?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@
  ### Create a cronjob in a specific namespace
  kubectl run pi --schedule="59 23 31 2 *" --namespace=test-jobs --generator=cronjob/v1beta1 "--image=$IMAGE_PERL" --restart=OnFailure -- perl -Mbignum=bpi -wle 'print bpi(20)' "${kube_flags[@]:?}"
  # Post-Condition: assertion object exists
  kube::test::get_object_assert 'cronjob/pi --namespace=test-jobs' "{{$id_field}}" 'pi'
